docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
RyTuneX is a system optimization tool aimed at improving the performance, privacy, and usability of Windows systems. Designed for everyday users, gamers and those seeking a more streamlined experience, RyTuneX offers:

  • Debloating of unnecessary apps and services.
  • Performance tweaks to enhance system responsiveness.
  • Privacy controls to manage telemetry and system settings.

Built using .NET 8 and the latest Windows UI WinUI 3, RyTuneX provides a straightforward and modern interface, making optimization accessible to all users.

docs.title: Interface Preview
docs.text: Experience a clean and user-friendly interface designed for productivity.

docs.title: Why Choose RyTuneX?
docs.text:
• Focused on Performance: Includes features to help improve system responsiveness and reduce unnecessary resource usage.
  • Simple and Accessible: An intuitive interface designed for ease of use, even for beginners.
  • Privacy-Conscious: Offers tools to manage telemetry and enhance privacy settings.

Have feedback or suggestions? Check out the Contributing page or Contact Me.

Let's optimize your Windows experience together!

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
We welcome contributions to RyTuneX! If you would like to contribute, please follow these steps:

  1. Fork the repository on GitHub.
  2. Make your changes and commit them to the testing branch.
  3. Submit a pull request to the repository.

docs.title: Contribution Guidelines
docs.text:
• Ensure your code follows the project's coding style.
  • Write clear and concise commit messages.
  • Include documentation for any new features or changes.
  • Test your changes thoroughly before submitting a pull request.

docs.title: Basic System Optimization
docs.text:
• Menu Show Delay: Adjust the delay before menus are shown.
  • Mouse Hover Time: Adjust the time before hover actions are triggered.
  • Auto Complete: Enable or disable auto-complete features.
  • Crash Dump: Enable or disable crash dump creation.
  • Remote Assistance: Enable or disable remote assistance.
  • Window Shake: Enable or disable the Aero Shake feature.
  • Copy Move Context Menu: Enable or disable copy/move context menu options.
  • Task Timeouts: Adjust task timeouts for better performance.
  • Low Disk Space Checks: Enable or disable low disk space checks.
  • Link Resolve: Enable or disable link resolution.
  • Service Timeouts: Adjust service timeouts for better performance.
  • Remote Registry: Enable or disable remote registry access.
  • File Extensions and Hidden Files: Show or hide file extensions and hidden files.

docs.title: Advanced System Optimization
docs.text:
• System Profile: Adjust system profile settings for performance.
  • GPU and Priority Settings: Optimize GPU and process priority settings.
  • Frame Server Mode: Enable or disable frame server mode.
  • Low Latency GPU Settings: Optimize GPU settings for low latency.
  • Non Best Effort Limit: Adjust non-best effort limits for better performance.
  • Disable SysMain: Disable the SysMain service to reduce unnecessary disk usage.
  • Disable NTFS Timestamp: Disable NTFS timestamp updates to improve file system performance.
  • Enable Gaming Mode: Optimize system settings for gaming performance.
  • Exclude Drivers from Windows Updates: Prevent Windows from updating drivers automatically.

docs.title: Other System Optimization
docs.text:
• System Restore: Enable or disable system restore.
  • Cortana: Enable or disable Cortana.
  • Store Updates: Enable or disable automatic store updates.
  • Automatic Updates: Enable or disable automatic Windows updates.
  • Smart Screen: Enable or disable the SmartScreen filter.

docs.title: Repair Options
docs.text:
• DISM: Use the Deployment Imaging Service and Management Tool to repair Windows images.
  • SFC: Use the System File Checker to scan and repair system files.
  • CHKDSK: Use the Check Disk utility to check and repair disk errors.

docs.title: Diagnose Options
docs.text:
• Battery Health: Generate a battery health report.
  • Memory Diagnostic: Run a memory diagnostic to check for memory issues.
  • Disk Optimizations: Perform disk optimizations.
  • Event Viewer: Open the Event Viewer to check system logs.

docs.title: System Debloating
docs.text:
• Uninstall UWP Apps: Easily uninstall unwanted UWP apps to free up system resources.
  • Remove Temporary Files: Clean up temporary files to free up disk space.

docs.title: Advertising Settings
docs.text:
• Advertising ID: Enable or disable the use of an advertising ID for personalized ads.
  • Bluetooth Advertising: Enable or disable Bluetooth advertising.
  • News and Interests: Enable or disable news and interests features.
  • Spotlight Features: Enable or disable Windows Spotlight features.
  • Tailored Experiences: Enable or disable tailored experiences based on diagnostic data.
  • Cloud Optimized Content: Enable or disable cloud-optimized content.
  • Feedback Notifications: Enable or disable feedback notifications.

docs.title: Telemetry Settings
docs.text:
• Telemetry Services: Enable or disable telemetry services.
  • Edge Telemetry: Enable or disable telemetry for Microsoft Edge.
  • Visual Studio Telemetry: Enable or disable telemetry for Visual Studio.
  • Nvidia Telemetry: Enable or disable telemetry for Nvidia products.
  • Chrome Telemetry: Enable or disable telemetry for Google Chrome.
  • Firefox Telemetry: Enable or disable telemetry for Mozilla Firefox.
  • Activity Feed: Enable or disable activity feed.
  • Cdp: Enable or disable Connected Devices Platform (CDP).
  • Diagnostics Toast: Enable or disable diagnostic toast notifications.
  • Online Speech Privacy: Enable or disable online speech privacy settings.
  • Location Features: Enable or disable location features.
  • Biometrics: Enable or disable biometric data collection.

docs.title: Other Settings
docs.text:
• Automatic Restart Sign-On: Enable or disable automatic restart sign-on.
  • Handwriting Data Sharing: Enable or disable sharing of handwriting data.
  • Text Input Data Collection: Enable or disable text input data collection.
  • Input Personalization: Enable or disable input personalization.
  • Safe Search Mode: Enable or disable safe search mode.
  • Activity Uploads: Enable or disable activity uploads.
  • Clipboard Sync: Enable or disable clipboard synchronization.
  • Message Sync: Enable or disable message synchronization.
  • Setting Sync: Enable or disable setting synchronization.
  • Voice Activation: Enable or disable voice activation.
  • Find My Device: Enable or disable the Find My Device feature.
  • SMBv1: Enable or disable SMBv1 protocol.
  • SMBv2: Enable or disable SMBv2 protocol.

docs.title: General Features
docs.text:
• Verbose Logon: Enable or disable verbose logon messages.
  • Hibernation: Enable or disable the hibernation feature.
  • Home Group: Enable or disable the Home Group feature.
  • Print Service: Enable or disable the print service.
  • Compatibility Assistant: Enable or disable the Program Compatibility Assistant.
  • Search: Enable or disable the search feature.
  • Error Reporting: Enable or disable Windows error reporting.
  • Game Bar: Enable or disable the Game Bar.
  • Quick Access History: Enable or disable Quick Access history.
  • My People: Enable or disable the My People feature.
  • Sensor Services: Enable or disable sensor services.
  • Windows Ink: Enable or disable Windows Ink.
  • Spelling and Typing Features: Enable or disable spelling and typing features.
  • Fax Service: Enable or disable the fax service.
  • Insider Service: Enable or disable the Windows Insider service.
  • Cloud Clipboard: Enable or disable the cloud clipboard feature.
  • Sticky Keys: Enable or disable sticky keys.
  • Cast to Device: Enable or disable the Cast to Device feature.

docs.title: Windows 11 Specific Features
docs.text:
• VBS: Enable or disable Virtualization-Based Security (VBS).
  • End Task: Enable or disable the End Task option in the taskbar.
  • Classic Context Menu: Enable or disable the classic context menu.
  • Taskbar to Left: Move the taskbar to the left.
  • Snap Assist: Enable or disable Snap Assist.
  • Widgets: Enable or disable Windows Widgets.
  • Chat: Enable or disable the Chat feature.
  • Files Compact Mode: Enable or disable compact mode in File Explorer.
  • Stickers: Enable or disable stickers on the desktop.
  • Edge Discover Bar: Enable or disable the Edge Discover Bar.
  • CoPilot AI: Enable or disable CoPilot AI.

docs.title: Network Management
docs.text:
• Change DNS Server: Easily change the DNS server to popular options like Google, Cloudflare, OpenDNS, and more.
  • Reset DNS to Default: Reset DNS settings to default values.

docs.title: System Security
docs.text:
• Virus & Threat Protection: Displays the status of virus and threat protection.
  • Firewall & Network Protection: Displays the status of firewall and network protection.
  • Windows Update: Displays the status of Windows updates.
  • SmartScreen: Displays the status of SmartScreen.
  • Real-Time Protection: Displays the status of real-time protection.
  • User Account Control (UAC): Displays the status of User Account Control (UAC).

docs.title: System Information
docs.text:
• OS Information: Display detailed information about the operating system.
  • CPU Information: Display detailed information about the CPU.
  • GPU Information: Display detailed information about the GPU.
  • RAM Information: Display detailed information about the RAM.
  • Disk Information: Display detailed information about the disk drives.
  • Extract Drivers: Extract drivers for easier backup.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text: • Windows 10 version 19041.0 (May 2020 Update) or later.

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
1. Download the latest release of RyTuneX from the GitHub Releases page.
  2. Extract the downloaded ZIP file to a desired location.
  3. Run the RyTuneXSetup.exe file to install the application.
  4. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the installation.

docs.title: Support
docs.text: If you encounter any issues or have any questions, please open a new issue on GitHub.

docs.title: What is RyTuneX?
docs.text: RyTuneX is an advanced optimization tool designed for Windows 10 and 11. It boosts system performance, manages resources, enhances privacy, and removes unnecessary software, ensuring a smoother and faster computing experience.

docs.title: How does RyTuneX improve system performance?
docs.text: RyTuneX fine-tunes system settings, optimizes memory usage, and streamlines background processes. It removes bloatware, disables unnecessary services, and enhances system responsiveness for better performance.

docs.title: Is RyTuneX safe to use?
docs.text: Yes, RyTuneX is safe to use. It performs non-invasive tweaks that do not modify essential system files. It has been thoroughly tested to ensure it will not cause any damage.

docs.title: Can RyTuneX harm my computer?
docs.text: No, RyTuneX is designed to make only beneficial changes to your system. All optimizations are reversible, and it avoids any potentially harmful modifications to your system or hardware components.

docs.title: What are the system requirements for RyTuneX?
docs.text: RyTuneX is compatible with Windows 10 version 21H2 and above, as well as all versions of Windows 11. It is lightweight and runs efficiently on both older and newer hardware configurations.

docs.title: How can I get support for RyTuneX?
docs.text: For support, you can join our Discord Community, where we can assist with any questions or issues you encounter while using RyTuneX or simply by opening a new issue.

docs.title: How do I uninstall RyTuneX?
docs.text: To uninstall RyTuneX, go to your settings, Apps, select Installed Apps, find RyTuneX in the list, and click on the three buttons then Uninstall.

docs.title: How do I revert changes made by RyTuneX?
docs.text: Navigate to the Settings page in RyTuneX, scroll down to the Revert Changes section, and click the Revert button to undo all changes applied by RyTuneX to the system.

docs.title: Can I customize the optimizations applied by RyTuneX?
docs.text: Yes, you can customize the optimizations by navigating to the respective sections (e.g., Optimize, Debloat, Privacy) and toggling the specific tweaks and settings you want to apply.

docs.title: Does RyTuneX require an internet connection to work?
docs.text: No, RyTuneX does not require an internet connection to perform optimizations. However, an internet connection is needed to download updates and access online support.

docs.title: How often should I use RyTuneX?
docs.text:
You can use RyTuneX as often as needed to maintain optimal system performance. It's recommended to reapply the changes after every major windows update to help keep your system running smoothly.

For further assistance, you can contact me at ghanmirayen12@gmail.com.

docs.title: Launching the Application
docs.text:
1. Open the Start menu and search for RyTuneX.
  2. Click on the RyTuneX application.
  3. Accept the UAC prompt and you should be good to go.

docs.title: Navigating the Application
docs.text:
• Home Page: This is the starting point for navigating through RyTuneX. It includes real-time usage statistics and a count of installed apps and services.
  • Optimize: Access various system optimization features to improve performance. This includes performance tweaks, and more.
  • Repair: Access various diagnostic and repair options to fix common system issues and ensure your system runs smoothly.
  • Debloat: Uninstall unwanted UWP apps and remove temporary files to free up system resources and improve performance.
  • Privacy: Disable telemetry services and enhance privacy settings to protect your personal data and reduce background data collection.
  • Features: Control your Windows features, enabling or disabling specific functionalities to customize your system according to your needs.
  • Networking: Change DNS server settings and reset DNS to default values. This helps in managing your network settings for better performance and security.
  • Device: View detailed information about the operating system, CPU, GPU, RAM, and disk drives. This section provides comprehensive hardware and system information.
  • Security: Preview the current state of different system security features to keep your system as secure as possible.
  • Settings: Configure application settings, including theme and language preferences, to personalize your RyTuneX experience.

docs.title: Uninstalling UWP Apps
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Debloat page.
  2. Select the apps you want to uninstall from the list.
  3. Click the Uninstall button to remove the selected apps.

docs.title: Changing DNS Server
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Networking page.
  2. Select a DNS server from the dropdown list.
  3. Click the Apply DNS button to change the DNS server.

docs.title: Extracting Drivers
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Device page.
  2. Click the Extract Drivers button to extract drivers to a specified folder.

docs.title: Optimizing System Performance
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Optimize page.
  2. Toggle the performance tweaks you want and they should be applied automatically.

docs.title: Running Diagnostics and Repairs
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Repair page.
  2. Click the Check/Diagnose button to start the diagnostic or repair process you want.

docs.title: Enhancing Privacy Settings
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Privacy page.
  2. Toggle the privacy settings you want to enable or disable.

docs.title: Controlling Windows Features
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Features page.
  2. Toggle the Windows features you want to enable or disable.

docs.title: Viewing System Information
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Device page.
  2. View detailed information about the operating system, CPU, GPU, RAM, and disk drives.

docs.title: Previewing Security Features
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Security page.
  2. Preview the current state of different system security features.

docs.title: Configuring Application Settings
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Settings page.
  2. Configure application settings, including theme and language preferences.

docs.title: Reverting Applied Changes
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Settings page.
  2. Scroll down to the Revert Changes section.
  3. Click the Revert button to undo all changes applied by RyTuneX to the system.
